title: History relived !
review: In Ajmer there are remnants of the Mughal era which today houses the Govt. museum . The beautiful fine work on stone jhokhas , the walls and the parts of this magnificent structure stand out even today and reminds one of the era . The location is well known . And there is never any crowd .A nominal fee .

title: Sir Thomas Roe's trade permission window is here
review: Historic , upgraded and worth a single visit...sir Thomas Roe took permission from the Moghuls to trade in India , in this very fort...centrally located

title: Historical.
review: When I am in a museum  with pieces and statues that fo back 5000 years I am completely  impressed.  15 and 16 century  statues as well.  It is very impressive

title: Excellent place and have hefty historical recordings
review: I am very much impressed in the Indus valley civilization finds are kept here. The description and ambiance of the museum is excellent and well maintained. Indian kids visiting here, please carry your school identity cards for discount entry. Spend as much of time to read the details. Photography is not allowed is the great disappointment.

title: Avoid
review: This place is at a distance of approx 1-2 km from the Ajmer Sharif Dargah. This place has got nothing to offer in terms of architecture. It’s simply a museum. Visiting this place is a time waste.

title: Recently Renovated
review: Akbar's name is practically wiped out from here as the building now houses government museum. Renovated in 2017 by Rajasthan government, it was built by Akbar and is centrally located. The number of galleries house original artefacts and their replica in a tastefully done layout. The central building has life sized models of important moments from history, I liked the one where Thomas Roe is in Jahangir's audience. The light and sound show is abandoned, might have been interesting. The tickets are priced at ₹20 for Indians. Di visit if interested in history.

title: Best place
review: Best place to visit in Ajmer you will get all the old stuffs their ...must visit once if you visiting Ajmer

title: Small and average museum----
review: I have written a review on government museum recently and government museum or Akbar's Palace and museum is the same place

title: Be there to see Mohanjodaro era items.
review: Ajmer musuim is one of the gem in Ajmer.It has been renovated recently. It houses some of the rarest statues, articles excavated from  Mohan jodaro.It is said that business agreement between India and East India Company was signed here.

title: Expected more
review: From the name of the Palace we expected to see more.  Having been built in 1590, I thought we would be able to see furnishings and rooms as they were in olden times.  You can only see an internal courtyard with a building inside that you can't enter.  It is now a government museum with a collection of pottery, religious statues and carvings, miniature paintings and weapons displayed in rooms that open onto the courtyard.  They are nicely displayed, but I expected to see a "palace".

title: Good renovation work. Limited collection but well displayed.
review: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the renovation work done at the museum. It has a small limited number of artefacts on display and done nicely. Overall an enriching experience.

title: Good collection of  very very Old stuff
review: Nice place for visitors. You can see very very Old collection of idols, coins and many more thing. I like the very much about the Hindu God's idols collection.

title: Renovated & nicely done
review: Though i do not take too much interest in visiting museum but I really liked this one. It has been recently renovated (in 2017). Only thing that was missing was more details about the displayed object in terms of its significance. You would need about 1-2 hrs to enjoy this place.Entry ticket for Indians is Rs 20.

title: Must visit in Ajmer
review: The museum has artifacts and scriptures related Mughal and Rajputana history. The local history is depicted through various installations and gallery. Its well maintained and is one the few must visited places in Ajmer. Walking distance from railway station or take an auto to reach here

title: Historically Very Important
review: Before visiting Ajmer, we never knew that in addition to the Ajmer Sharif, Ajmer has many other historical sites!

title: Can visit if history excites you
review: This place is near Ajmer Sharif Dargah parking area. Can be easily seen from the main road. They have specified timing and basic entry fee. But for foreigners, it is pretty high. You will get to see all history sculptures, images, weapons, stories inside the museum. Can be difficult to visit during summer.

title: Partially under renovation; interesting museum
review: Visited this place in September'17, the museum was under renovation. However, the part which was open was amazing.

title: akbar palace
review: its a nice place but this is not situated at main road it is very inside the madar market of ajmer  you have to take a tempo/auto/ola to reach station and then you can enter the madar market or you can take rikshaw to reach here.

title: Ok Ok
review: Our experience was OK OK.  It is a proper museum. There were many historical things. It has Garden in the centre. We were told that it is renewed few months back.

title: Awesome
review: This palace is made by the akbar and spread in a large area...

title: A view of the Rajputana Life and Akbar regime
review: The palace itself is magnificent and has great architectural value... however the light and sound show .. takes the tourists on journey named India... simply mesmerising

title: Why not to visit?
review: The assertion that this is a powerful fortress, is an overstatement. It's rather a fortified palace than a fortress. Not surprisingly, it finally has not found another use, except to be a museum. State museum, of course. It has quite a variety of funds, ranging from the artifacts found during the excavation, and ending with, for example, items from the armoury of the British colonial troops. But there are also quite old figurins - even of 6-8-century - including the famous statue of the goddess Kali. Numismatics, fragments of rock carvings and inscriptions, miniature paintings, books – and all within walking distance from the train station. Why not to visit?

title: a small museum..
review: It’s a small fort situated in a small garden surrounded by rooms on all the four sides. We can’t enter into the main building, and some items are exhibited in the rooms in the 4 sides. I didn’t feel much special about this fort.. maximum for  1 hour.

title: Amazing place
review: It is a very beautiful historical palace we found here many ancient historical things good tourism spot

title: Major Tourist Place
review: I went to Akbar's Palace and Museum. Akbar's palace, constructed in 1500AD as the place where he and his troops stayed in at Ajmer, lies in the centre of the town and is a major tourist magnet. The museum showcases various aspects of the Rajput and Mughal style of living and fighting. It is great place to go.

title: Awesomely well maintained despite surprisingly cheap entry fee
review: Simply beautiful, also, good archaeological finds are displayed in the museum. Many many rooms and excellent information boards and exit signs so one doesn't get lost. Most well maintained, state of the art museum I have seen in India. I also met Akbar and Jehangir in the building which stands in the center. Dont miss it. I heard some fools want to remove Akbar's name from this fort palace. It wont change the fact that Akbar built this little beauty as a pilgrimage home for himself and his family when they came to visit Ajmer Dargah Sharief every year.

title: One of the major attraction in Ajmer - Akbari Masjid!
review: One of the finest architectural structure made by the Mughal emperor, King Shah Jahan between 1627 - 58 AD as his devotion towards Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti (R.A) against his vow. A must visit for everyone! The good part is that the government & the people of Ajmer are doing everything possible to maintain it.

title: Good...
review: Such a beautiful museum. Design and Architecture of this building is great. Too many things which is related to our history are here. Light and sound show was great.

title: Our Past
review: Must  visit while you are in Ajmer specially when you are history lover and enjoy old memories, one feels lost in PAST.

title: Here Akbar n Salim made history
review: A beautiful architecture marvel in the centre of city Ajmer. Pretty small palace. Things are under restoration n renovation. Nice n small museum with lot of paintings and weapons.

title: Beatiful place with lots of History to know about
review: It you are going to Ajmer Akbar"s Palace is a "place to visit" for "sure".

title: Akbars Palace & Museum-Ajmer
review: Visited this place on 23/02/2017,it is the Place where Akbar was used to Stay now turned to Museum,A fee of Rs 20 per person is charged as entry fee,it closed by 5.30P.M.in evening

title: Highly recommended especially for Light and Sound show
review: A must visit to this monument, one of the few well conserved architectural structures in India. The detailing depicts synergies of Rajput architecture and Moghal Architecture.

title: Disappointing show
review: Run down pathetic place. The exhibits are too few. Very sad museum.

title: Akbar ka kila
review: Akbar ka Kila or Akbar's Fort is situated in Ajmer city of Rajasthan. Akbar ka kila is also known as Government Museum, Ajmer. Akbar's fort is situated in middle of Ajmer city. It was built by Akbar in 1570 for frequent visits to Ajmer as well as a bastion for his advancing empire. Akbar ka kila is very small as compare to other forts in Rajasthan, but in our opinion we would call it Government Museum, Ajmer. This fort is covered with high boundary-wall while museum gallery inside the fort's varamdah which contains brief history of Akbar's fort, Shila-lekh, various statues of 12th to 18th century. Akbar ka kila is important in history as Ajmer was the base for his operations in Rajputana during british raj and Sir Thomas Roe gets trade permission through the Court of Ajmir during Jahangir's regime.

title: Nothing much to speak about
review: Not much to say about.

title: Akbar's palace
review: Akbar's palace and musuem is popular place for tourist.this is beautiful place must see this palace.

title: Could not visit the Palace
review: The palace is located at the heart of the town of Ajmer. But during my visit the palace was in repairs and only the light & sound program was available which I missed due to other engagements. But I wish to come back and see it again

title: Sound and light show must
review: At  night the sound n light show is conducted.  First in english from 7.30 to 8.15 pm

title: Small museum
review: No feature of palace is visible except some decorated gate.

title: Museum
review: Akbar's Palace and museum is historical building .This building was built in Mughal Era. This building is located at Ajmer.

title: Nothing was new
review: Very small place nothing was new there was some old sculpture from different places some old guns and monuments

title: Birthplace to Mughal Emperor Shah Jhah's children
review: As the name suggests, the fort was built by the Mughals and was used both as a military fort and as a retreating palace by many Mughal Emperors. Though the fort has an interesting history, it is not really a majestic view as compared to other Mughal palaces/forts and can be easily skipped by anyone who has already visited Agra, Delhi or Jaipur. There is a visiting gallery with some historical artifacts like stone inscription, Indus Valley figurines and old idols of Hindu deities, but it is in rather a shabby state and can use a much needed overhaul.

title: Mughal Infrastructure
review: Akbar's palace, at the entrance you can see a cannon on the left side further there old monuments and old guns and shield used during wars. History lover will find place interesting.

title: Palace and monument
review: Akbar palace which was built by akbar. this place is now converted to museum you can find the mughal era cannon lying down. and inside the palace you can find different types of sword and guns which was used at that time during war time. there is a entry fees also.

title: Small palace & Museum
review: This palace is very small and entry is not allowed in main hall only access is granted in museum area which is around the palace. Museum fails to attract as most of the things have been brought from other areas of state to this place. It is said that meeting to plan for haldighati battle took place in this palace.

title: Historically beautiful!
review: A place to see and learn the art effect.some ruin and findings of past are displayed.little maintenance required otherwise nice to see and learn.

title: If you are visiting Ajmer and have some time
review: If you have a couple of days in Ajmer this is a very doable museum. It has a Mogul style architecture and some very fine 'jaalis" that is finely carved windows. Inside the museum has some prehistoric artifacts and some more recent ones. It can easily be done in half to one hour. It is a good photo stop.

title: Museum with small collection
review: Visited the Museum on 7jan2017 , the palce is now museum and which has very small collection of antices and stone, but good mange whatever they have

title: Nothing to be seen!
review: Although, it was on our list, but a real waste of time.

title: Old Palace.. can be skipped
review: The palace now houses the government museum and can be easily skipped if paucity of time is there. The museum is also not rich and can be visited if time allows.

title: Sound show is much better
review: I visited the venue during day time only to spend the time as my train was scheduled 3 hours later. Not a bad place but not really to do list. Do go for light and sound show.

title: Useless and very uncomfortable
review: I saw too many light and sound show but this place is useless and very uncomfortable and main problem is staff who take care this place .

title: nice place
review: a small but a nice place to be visit . well maintained clean area we seen . photography also allowed so  we take a pic for memorable place .

title: Birthplace of Akbar
review: Small but nice place. Not much artifacts & still maintenance going but enjoyable as this is  inside Ajmer city . From there the main bazaar is very close, so one can easily hop on there .

title: Light and Sound Show...
review: As the name indicates, this fort was constructed during Mughal era and Akbar and his successors spent many years in this fort. After the fall of Mughal empire, the Britishers converted a portion of the fort into a museum and some years back Light and Show was introduced by the Government of Rajasthan.

title: One of the strongest citadels
review: Akbars place and museum is one of the strongest citadels.it was the meting palace of jahangir and sir thomas roe, the  english ambassador.

title: Good
review: The palace also houses a museum. History lover who is interested in Mughul History should not miss this Akbar's palace.

title: Average Palace Museum..
review: Akbar's palace museum in Ajmer is a historical palace turned museum which was built by Emperor Akbar during his reign. However, its a small palace and has only 2 things to see here which are worthwhile:

title: Heritage Left orphan
review: Akbari Museum in Ajmer is a historical place. This is the place where Jahangir gave first audience to a British regent, Thomas roe. This is the place where Aurangzeb was holed up for months fending rebellion by his son Dara. This is the place where Jahanara breathed her last. This is the place where an iron statue of Maharana Pratap was installed and now has been dumped in a store yard. The place stinks of urine. I do not know why visitors are charged INR 20 to lament the ruins.

title: Glorious History ,Now in rumbles.
review: If interested in history it is fine. It is a small palace converted into museum.A big gun(Top) near the entrance is added attraction. If got spare time visit it.

title: Nice place
review: Very good place to visit with entry fee of Rs 20. very nice things kept in museum which will take you in history. good to spend an hour or less at this place.

title: Educative.....
review: We have 2 school going kids and as result try to take them to museums and historical places.....this is both .its a lovely old palace but unfortunately one is not allowed on upper part.

title: Excellent collection.
review: Nice insight into the historic era.  Good display of Weaponry, War Gear, Collections of Royal era.  Does have Sound & Light Show scheduled for evening.

title: Lonely
review: Located in the midst of the town, it is the palace converted into museum.Inside rows of small rooms converted to showcase artifacts of past.three galleries are there with interconnected rooms.Not many crowds visits this, you can have plenty of undisturbed time to cover the museum and took photographs.Washrooms are there inside the museum.15-20 minutes required to cover the whole complex.

title: A forgotten relic of another era
review: That it is a unique place right in the heart of Ajmer is a given. Unfortunately though it hardly gets even 1/10th of the treatment it deserves. It is dilapidated and falling down to pieces. Walls are moisture seeped and look like they received the last quote of paint during Akbar's rule. It is a museum and in fact has some very curious artifacts on display. But again, the way they are kept it looks like the charpoys and old stone grinding mills dumped in my grandma's attic! Most artifacts are in the open and gathering dust. They are placed on termite ridden wooden platforms and tables on which slivers of sepia toned and stained paper pieces carry an introduction to a fading history. Really ASI? Is this really how you maintain our national treasures? Please think better.

title: Nameless articles
review: This is a museum inside the for premises. They have various items, across various centuries. All these articles lack description. Many name plates are missing. Those that are there lack detailed explanation. You can touch many of the exhibits, which is not a great idea in the interest of preservation. This places needs some more work, it has the potential to be very good.

title: Nice
review: Good historic place with so many things from ancient era. It was good to visit this place and have a wonderful time, try this place if you ate into history and have love for that era.

title: Superb
review: Right in the heart of the city the fort is amazing.

title: Big portion start here of British era
review: Just near to Agra gate , It was basically made by Akbar during his visit to Ajmer , Jahangir also visited here , British history in India start here because Jahangir given permission here to British people to do business in India, not much attraction inside but build well and a good galley inside, visitor have to pay ticket during their visit, dont forget to drinnk famous lassi and kadi kachori which is very famous in ajmer just it near by circle.

title: FASCINATING HISTORY!
review: Very historical place, well maintained and tidy. it houses museum which have lots of relics and sculptures and rare inscriptions on stones,. so more importantly museum is rich for heritage view. But the main center of attraction is the Light and Sound show which is run on the first floor. stairs are big as its old palace! and there might be mosquitoes as its in open. the view and sitting is nice! The light and sound show runs for 45 mins. which consists of history of Prithviraj Chauhan till after India's independence., which is very well displayed and rich in history and general knowledge. i suggest its a must to watch when in Ajmer. its shown in English/Hindi.  Museum remains closed on Mondays

title: Akbar's Palace and Archeological Museum
review: It is an archeological museum with a number of artifacts that were unearthed during the excavations in the Ajmer region. Ajmer was a very important part of history of India and that could be seen in the variety of sculptures that are housed in the museum. It is clean and one should not miss it during the visit to Ajmer. It is close to Soniji ki Nasiyan. This fort was built by Akbar in the year 1570 A.D.

title: One of the must visit places when in ajmer
review: This is one of must visit places in Ajmer after the Dargah and other places.t

title: Roe's diplomacy efforts started here.
review: A guest house constructed in AD 1570 by Mughal Emperor Akbar, and in the early part of 17th century, the first meeting between the fourth Mughal Emperor Jahangir & Sir Thomas Roe happened in this place. This event (meeting) eventually resulted in the establishment of full-fledged trade-relations between the English traders and India. Hence this place has a great historical importance. Now this place is converted into a small museum. As well a light & sound show in the evening, provides a glimpse of history.

title: Rare  collection and History reviewed
review: Museum is very nice and collection of rare things. Well organised and well maintained. Please read the information note  to understand the history.

title: Lovely Monument
review: Built in 1570 A.D. by the Moghul emperor Akbar, this beautiful and well maintained palace definitely warrants a visit if you happen to be in Ajmer. The palace also houses a museum with a very good collection of sculptures,artefacts and arms. Timings are 9.45 AM to 5.15 PM and tickets cost Rs.10/-

title: Not a very important stop on your trip to Ajmer
review: I was on a solo trip to Ajmer. Completely relying on the Lonely Planet Indian edition book for Rajasthan. It's really helpful. I had decided to explore every place that was mentioned in the book. Akbar's Palace & Museum was one of the mention.

title: Awesome
review: A wonderful venue which helps to place India in context. Along with other venues in the Golden Triangle, this is a place not to be missed.

title: A sense of history
review: Why is a museum of ancient Indian antiquity there? Wish it could have been projected as a military structure by Akbar, with some earlier history & changes being explained!

title: A historical palace
review: i liked old historical articles. The palace is now not being maintained quite well and may be loosing the glorious past

title: Light and Sound
review: must see this light and sound. You will get the feelings of turning the history pages. I liked that light and sound and the recitation.

title: Must visit
review: Their collection is fabulous but I thin they are in grave need for funds. The staff refuse to even turn on teh lights so you can't see half the things properly. This is a ticketed place so I don't see why they can't afford proper lighting at least.

title: Architectural Beauty
review: Akbar's Palace is one of the most beautiful monuments in the city and shows the brilliant work of art and skill that has been used to construct this palace. The palace was built by great emperor Akbar, during the year 1570. This was later converted to a government museum. . One can see some very unique and rare relics which are prehistoric, a few epigraphs along with a collection which has been reserved. There is a library which can also be visited from 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, on all days except Monday.

title: Nice Feeling
review: I liked the monuments however the authorities need to maintain this heritage site properly. I saw some structures in a dilapidated condition and it needed some attention.

title: Not much of a Museum
review: Very poorly kept. The Diwan e khas was littered with pigeons droppings. There are some displays of historical importance dating to 11th century around. Overall the entire visit can be finished in less than an hour.

title: light and sound show
review: well we were told, this place doesn not have much to see, so we planned to visit at 6pm for the light and sound show. Trust me its worth watching, if you are interested to know about history. Ticket for single person cost around 50Rs. do try it

title: light &sound show at Akbar's palace
review: Its a nice show quite educative If one is intrested in history then this is the show one should see .Timings keep changing according to season so one check the timings

title: Nothing worth viewing
review: It has great historic value but has not been maintained very well by the administration. The exhibits are not cleaned properly and have not even been properly explained.

title: for history lovers
review: not a must do on the list.its just a museum with under repair architecture and few cannons. nothing to do as such.

title: just skip it
review: there is nothing to see at the palace and the museum. You can surely save your time by not visiting this place while in ajmer

title: A little effort could make this a lot more interesting
review: 50RP is the entry price. The museum actually has some interesting things - ancient sculptures and prehistoric relics, but as the signs are in Hindi it is quite frustrating. I felt it needed an overhaul, and attention to signage, as it is not going to satisfy visitors in its present state. The viceroy of King James I, Sir Thomas Roe, presented his credentials to the court here in 1615. Straight ahead as you leave the fort is Nara Bazaar, which is a place to look for silver in Ajmer.

title: Historical place , yet can be made more oragnized
review: Many people might not like the Ajmer fort and the museum. But any history lover who is interested in Mughul History should not miss this Akbar's palace. Now it houses a museum.This is the place where prince Jehangir was born, The museum houses some interesting  exhibits. But to the dismay of many tourists , the description is in Hindi. For students learning history, it may be interesting. One may be able to finish the museum in nearly one hour. In the middle lies the divan i khaz.Among exhibits there are photos of interesting places in Ajmer. It helped me to locate many places that I did not plan to visit. Pushkar gurudwara is one of them.Some times, the location may be confusing. Just ask for Naya bazar. It is located in the naya bazar. It is at  awalking distance from Ajmer Dhargah and in the middle of the Dargah and the Ana sagar lake. Actually, museum administrators can make this museum a bit organized and interesting.

title: Great sound and light show
review: Got to know of a sound and light show in this palace.. the place is getting renovated.. the show was great a bit lengthy and repetitive but a great first time experience.. cameras are allowed.. light effects are awesome.. with Sonu nigam qawali a special highlight... nice hour to spend for the first timers like me

title: Well kept
review: Museums in India are generally not kept clean or properly lit or well labeled. The Government Museum at Akbar's Palace is an exception. Not too many really exotic exhibits, but the simple ones are so nicely displayed that we had a great time retracing our steps often.

title: A great place to relive history.
review: A great sound and light show which just makes the whole structure talk about the historic events which took place. The music and songs were really nice. A must visit at a very nominal entry fee.

title: Mesmerizing experiance
review: Amazing voice which took us back to the history... Beautiful lightings and amazing background score.. The seating arrangements was just perfect..

title: great place for history buffs (like me) !!!
review: its a nice place.the main attraction is the centre hall,which was the decision making room of akbar during some war.many cool stuffs are there in the museum sorrounding the hall.there is a light and sound programme in the evening,so u can plan ur visit accordingly if you are interested.the fee is nominal.

title: museum
review: museum is very near to Delhi gate a walking distance and is also very near to the lake. most of the things are of akbar time when he used to visit ajmer.

title: WHERE THE EMPEROR OF INDIA RESIDES
review: It is a never forgetting memory to visit this marvelous palace.  We can experience the rear available sources of heaven beauty at one place ! Who can forget the greatness of Mughal empire , ruled in 16th Century winning the heart of people from all religions.  The unique pieces of Din-e-elahi's period are definitely memories for a long time.
